item.title: Where Expected Goals Falls Short
item.description: Recently across the soccer world, fans have been accustomed to an “Expected Goals(xG)” metric attached to both sides in any particular match. xG represents how many goals that team should be expected to score over the course of the game. The metric has been created by assigning each shot a team takes a value on a scale from 0 to 1 based on how likely that shot would be a goal.

item.title: Who Is The Dirtiest Player In The History of MLS?
item.description: Following the 1994 FIFA World Cup, the U.S Soccer Federation decided it was the right time to create a Division 1 soccer league within the country. Starting play in 1996 with 10 teams, Major League Soccer has now completed 25 seasons and expanded to a whopping 27 clubs, with plans out to 30 by the 2023 season. Throughout that history, the league has seen a number of aggressive, tough, and physical players pass through the ranks, coming from different countries across the globe.

item.title: Seperating College Football Scores
item.description: I am going to take CFB logs and seperate out the scores using code. Lets get started. library(tidyverse) ## -- Attaching packages --------------------------------------- tidyverse 1.3.0 -- ## v ggplot2 3.3.3 v purrr 0.3.4 ## v tibble 3.0.5 v dplyr 1.0.3 ## v tidyr 1.1.2 v stringr 1.4.0 ## v readr 1.4.0 v forcats 0.5.0 ## -- Conflicts ------------------------------------------ tidyverse_conflicts() -- ## x dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter() ## x dplyr::lag() masks stats::lag() library(ggalt) ## Warning: package 'ggalt' was built under R version 4.

item.title: About
item.description: My name is Peyton Thomas and I created this page to present data about sports.
